AttributeList.Text: phase_example This some general description in a comment table. This is a new line in the description. This is another comment table without borders. This is a new line in the 2nd table
Make the Phase ID based on its DB number

LineComment.Text: Load the command from the HMI in AR1
copy all commands to the bools

AttributeList.Text: Get the commands from the HMI that have been received in the last cycle They come in a DWORD to save tags They need to be transferred to BOOLS for easy use Once transferred then clear the DWORD so new commands can be detected in the next cycle

LineComment.Text: copy all commands to the bools

AttributeList.Text: Get the commands from the HMI that have been received in the last cycle They come in a DWORD to save tags They need to be transferred to BOOLS for easy use Once transferred then clear the DWORD so new commands can be detected in the next cycle
Combine the commands from the HMI and PLC in one command (OR-function)

If the previous stepnumber is not the same as the current one then reset the timers, else increase them This is at the start of the FB because normal stepchanges will take till the next cycle to become active

If timers are needed that cannot be solved with the steptime. Timers need to start with the name 'timer' They are paused by default They can be unpaused They can be reset by writing the value to 0 in the action Every timer is available in s, m and h
create a pulse active on the first cycle of a new scan this signal can be used in the step to execute some actions in the first cycle of the step

LineComment.Text: config: target step for this command (-1 if not used)
hold condition active, configured outside this FB
config: target step for this command (-1 if not used)
Disabled in this config because we only want to allow abort when held
config: target step for this command (-1 if not used)
config: target step for this command (-1 if not used)

AttributeList.Text: Change States -------------------------------- This phase template is design to let the stepnumber be the single source of truth for the state of the phase. All other indicators of state from this phase are deducted from the stepnumber. And the state can only be changed by changing the stepnumber For every state we both create a bit, and an integer value Both have the same meaning and can be chosen for usage based on what is most convenient

LineComment.Text: Disable all permissions for the commands
The individial permissions will be set again
in the next steps depending on the state

AttributeList.Text: Update Phase States based on the stepnumber 0 idle 1 running 2 completed 3 pausing 4 paused 5 holding 6 held 7 restarting 8 stopping 9 stopped 10 aborting 11 aborted ------------------------------- See previous network for explanation
Collect the errors from the connected Modules (CMs and EMs)

This code tries to assign an error message to each CM error If multiple CMs have an error then it only stores one This is the phase type so we don't know which CM/EM instance is connected So the error only contains the general name of the CM/EM instance If the actual name needs to be shown then it could be deducted at a higher level using the CM/EM name and phase instance
Assign a message number to each error
START OF THE STEPS AND TRANSITIONS

make sure RLO is high so the transition can happen when no conditions present
End of network: jump here if step not active
Jump to end of this FB if the step has been active to avoid
execution of another step in the same scan
